intro: Curcuma eburnea, commonly known as the white turmeric, is a rhizomatous herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The botanical features of Curcuma eburnea make it an important species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
